entry.def: You use their to indicate that something belongs or relates to the group of people, animals, or things that you are talking about.

example.ex: Janis and Kurt have announced their engagement...
example.tran: 贾尼斯和库尔特已宣布订婚。

example.ex: Horses were poking their heads over their stall doors.
example.tran: 马儿们从马厩门上探出头来。

entry.def: You use their instead of 'his or her' to indicate that something belongs or relates to a person without saying whether that person is a man or a woman. Some people think this use is incorrect.
entry.tran: (代替 his or her，而不指明是男是女;有人认为这种用法不对)

example.ex: Every member will receive their own 'Welcome to Labour' brochure.
example.tran: 每个党员都将收到一本名为《欢迎加入工党》的小册子。

example.ex: But anyone looking for income from their investments is in a much worse state.
example.tran: 但是，那些指望靠投资获取收入的人境况更为糟糕。

sentences.cn: 田纳西州的各个专业技术学院和社区大学不会将他们的设施管理外包给什么私营企业，有领导称，一项针对各院校支出的分析支持了这一决定。
sentences.en: Tennessee’s technical and community colleges will notoutsource (外包) management of their facilities to a privatecompany, a decision one leader said was bolstered by ananalysis of spending at each campus.

sentences.cn: 鉴于不到一半的美国人表示他们的厨艺水平仅达中等，只有20% 的人认为自己的厨艺精湛，所以问题其实在于自信心。
sentences.en: Since fewer than half of Americans say they cook at an intermediate level and only 20% describe their cooking skills as advanced, the crisis is one of confidence.

sentences.cn: 在到达某个程度后，国家会变得充满危险，以致食品救济人员的安全也不再能得到保障，他们的救济计划也会停止。
sentences.en: After  a  point,  countries  can  become  so dangerous  that  food  relief  workers  are  no  longer  safe  and their programs are halted.

sentences.cn: “造成差异的是他们所处具体环境的特点，以及他们自身的特点——他们对自身健康程度的感觉，他们的年龄和婚姻状况。”Robison博士解释说。
sentences.en: “It is the characteristics of the specific environment they are in, combined with their own personal characteristics—how healthy they feel they are, their age and marital status,” Dr. Robison explained.

sentences.en: This their way is their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.
